title: Chris Kluwe: The Courage and Cost of Civil Disobedience
description: Join us for a conversation with former NFL player and author Chris Kluwe, discussing civil disobedience and standing up for beliefs.
raw_text:
Wilkinson College
the heart and soul of Chapman

JOIN US FOR A COMPELLING CONVERSATION WITH

CHRIS KLUWE:
THE COURAGE AND COST OF CIVIL DISOBEDIENCE

FORMER NFL PLAYER AND AUTHOR CHRIS KLUWE WILL DISCUSS THE POWER AND CONSEQUENCES OF CIVIL DISOBEDIENCE

Kluwe was recently handcuffed, arrested and forcibly removed from a Huntington Beach City Council meeting while opposing the use of public funds to promote MAGA ideology at the local library. In this question-and-answer session, Kluwe will share his experiences with civil disobedience, the personal and professional risks of standing up for one's beliefs, and what it truly means to fight for democracy in today's America. Don't miss this timely discussion on courage and the price of dissent.

THURSDAY APRIL 24 4PM TO 5PM ARGYROS FORUM 208

CHAPMAN UNIVERSITY
Wilkinson College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences

title: Worker Safety Under Attack: Stories From the Fightback
description: We are hosting a workshop presented by the Health and Safety Committee of the Arizona Jobs with Justice Coalition, focusing on worker safety during the COVID pandemic and organizing efforts for workers‚Äô rights. Testimonies from workers and advocates will highlight workplace safety issues.
meeting_location: Salt of the Earth Labor College
sponsors: The Health and Safety Committee of the Arizona Jobs with Justice Coalition
raw_text:
Salt of the Earth Labor College

WORKER SAFETY UNDER ATTACK: STORIES FROM THE FIGHTBACK

Workshop presented by The Health and Safety Committee of the Arizona Jobs with Justice Coalition

Saturday, April 26th 4:00 to 5:30 pm Salt of the Earth Labor College 1902 E. Irene Vista in Tucson Please note the time change from our usual

Worker safety was the major story of the COVID pandemic. Essential workers were thrown into deadly danger to service the rest of us - without protections! Eventually workers organized in ways never seen before - organizing campaigns led by workers started happening in Starbucks, Amazon and the agro-industry. Public support for workers & unions reached an all-time high Point.

The first Trump administration forced meatpacking workers back to the job in spite of deadly conditions in the food factories. The many botched policies related to the pandemic made the US the butt joke for the rest of the world. Unions gained more power to protect its members and build strong alliances with unorganized workers.

Safety has come a long way. Its ability to organize and fight corporate overreach is huge. Which is why it's under attack. We must demand HANDS OFF of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration(OSHA). We also need to protect injured workers' rights to proper healthcare, disability insurance(SDI), Medicaid, and a National Labor Relations Board that protects their right to unionize. It took decades of struggle for working people to win some protections from greedy corporate bosses. We need to protest. We need to organize. We need more creative ways to struggle.

Come hear testimonies of workers and advocates for lifting up worker safety. The end of April is the time of year to call attention to workplace safety. Arizona loses a hundred workers per year to traumatic fatal deaths. An estimated two thousand workers die from exposure to health hazards such as heat or chemical exposure. Tens of thousands are seriously injured by work - often to be challenged and degraded by a Worker compensation system that devalues them and treats them like trash.

There‚Äôs no a better issue for workers to organize around - come hear how it works

For more information about Salt of the Earth Labor College please email to SELC@webtv.net or call (520)325-0694. We will be depending on your generosity to keep us going. We still need to maintain our building, pay for insurance, property taxes, and do mailings, etc. You can mail checks to- Salt of the Earth Labor College, 1902 East Irene Vista, Tucson AZ 85713

1902 E. Irene Vista Tucson, AZ 85713
raw_summary: The image advertises an event by Salt of the Earth Labor College focusing on worker safety during and after the COVID pandemic. It shares stories of workers' fight for rights and safety measures.
